name: general_medical_guidelines_for_arogyamitra
description: General clinical and procedural guideline snippets used by the Procedure Validator and Translate tools. Not a substitute for clinical judgment — intended for triage / heuristic checks in the hackathon prototype.

common_indications: Imaging consistent with appendicitis (enlarged appendix, wall thickening, periappendiceal fat stranding)
Clinical signs: migrating abdominal pain, right lower quadrant tenderness, fever, raised WBC/CRP
Perforation or free intraperitoneal air on imaging
relative_indications: Early/uncertain appendicitis with stable clinical exam — consider antibiotic trial and observation
Small appendiceal phlegmon or abscess managed conservatively or by percutaneous drainage followed by interval appendectomy
conservative_alternatives: Short course of intravenous antibiotics and observation
Repeat imaging and clinical reassessment within 24–48 hours
appendectomy.notes: If imaging *and* clinical findings concordant → surgery commonly recommended. If imaging ambiguous and patient stable, conservative approach may be reasonable.

common_indications: Symptomatic cholelithiasis with recurrent biliary colic
Acute cholecystitis on imaging (gallbladder wall thickening, pericholecystic fluid, sonographic Murphy's sign)
Choledocholithiasis with obstructive jaundice (after ERCP planning)
conservative_alternatives: Antibiotics and observation for early or mild acute cholecystitis
ERCP for common bile duct stones before definitive cholecystectomy
cholecystectomy.notes: Timing may be urgent in complicated cholecystitis; uncomplicated symptomatic gallstones may be elective.

common_indications: Visually significant lens opacity affecting activities of daily living (driving, reading)
Best-corrected visual acuity reduced and visually symptomatic patient consents to surgery
conservative_alternatives: Spectacle correction if visual impairment is mild and not function-limiting
red_flags: No absolute red flags — surgery elective unless complicated by other ocular emergencies
cataract_surgery.notes: Decision is largely patient-function driven; confirm ocular fitness pre-op.

common_indications: Mechanical symptoms (locking, catching) or persistent pain after conservative therapy
Large displaced tear on MRI in young, active patients
conservative_alternatives: Intra-articular steroid injection in select patients
red_flags: Concurrent ligamentous instability requiring surgical correction
partial_medial_meniscus_tear.notes: Most partial tears initially managed conservatively unless mechanical symptoms persist.

common_indications: Symptomatic hernia causing pain or risk of strangulation
conservative_alternatives: Watchful waiting for small asymptomatic inguinal hernias in low-risk patients
Truss/band support only as temporary measure
red_flags: Signs of strangulation (severe pain, erythema, systemic signs)
hernia_repair.notes: Emergent intervention required if strangulation or incarceration suspected.

haemoglobin.interpretation_notes: Values below urgent_threshold typically need prompt clinical attention; mild reductions require workup (iron studies, indices).

wbc_total.interpretation_notes: Very low ANC or neutropenia with fever is urgent; leukocytosis suggests infection/inflammation.

platelet_count.interpretation_notes: Platelets below urgent_threshold need urgent review if bleeding present; mild thrombocytopenia often observed and followed up.

crp.interpretation_notes: Rises with inflammation or infection; use trend with clinical context.

bilirubin_total.interpretation_notes: Marked hyperbilirubinemia (>3 mg/dl) may need urgent hepatology review.

price_check_tips: Compare billed total with expected package price from partner hospital dataset.
Flag single-line items greater than 'large_single_charge_threshold' in billing_rules.json.

templates.procedure_validator_prompt_template:
Given the following report excerpt and the standard indications for {procedure_name}, decide whether the procedure is: Required / Possibly avoidable / Not recommended. Provide short rationale and 2 alternatives if appropriate.

Report excerpt:
{report_excerpt}

Return EXACTLY in this format:
Necessity: <Required | Possibly avoidable | Not recommended>
Rationale: <one or two sentences>
Alternatives:
- <alternative 1>
- <alternative 2>

how_to_use_in_procedure_validator: Load this JSON at startup or on-demand in validate_procedure.py.
When a report is uploaded, extract the text and numeric values (labs) and search for imaging keywords.
If the report contains any 'urgent_keywords' then mark as URGENT and escalate.
To validate a recommended procedure: compare the report text against 'procedures[<proc_key>].common_indications' and 'imaging_findings.surgery_suggestive_keywords'.

If multiple strong indications (eg. imaging keyword + supportive lab + clinical mention) exist, label 'Required'. If ambiguous or only clinical suspicion without imaging confirmation, label 'Possibly avoidable'.
security_and_disclaimer: These are heuristic rules for prototype/demo use only. They are NOT medical advice.
Always show results as 'recommendation' and encourage user to consult treating physician.
